Description: The very narrow carriageways on Broadway prevent there being two lanes of traffic, so very long tailback occur.  This plus very poorly timed lights at Stirling Hwy makes for extreme frustration and anger.  Motorbikes and even occasionally small cars go onto the footpath to circumvent congestion.
Very heavy traffic on the road, with many potential turns into side streets or businesses.  Need a centre lane so that turning traffic does not block traffic.

Location: Aberdare Rd & Gairdner Dr, Shenton Park
Description: Travelling west on Aberdare, many cars turn right into Derby, but often indicate late. If you are behind one of these turning cars, you have to stop - but - the traffic behind zooms around you on the INSIDE. There is only ONE lane, so this "inside passing" is really risky. Perhaps there needs to be TWO lanes here.
all of Stirling Hwy from Bruce St to Dalkeith Rd lacks provision to turn to the right across traffic
Lots of school children use this everyday and are put in danger as you can�۪t see cars accelerating up princess from broadway.

Stirling Highway has become more and more congested over the years and now the government wants to increase the population density and businesses, particularly by adding two shopping centers at the Captain Stirling site. I understand that the vehicle movement increase will be in the order of 60,000 per week. Stirling Highway at this point cannot be widened and may need additional traffic lights within 200m of the Dalkeith Road lights.
Cars leaving Hollywood Hospital have sight blocked by taxis - cannot see approaching traffic from west

Stirling Hwy is extremely busy & dangerous in its full length from Perth to Fremantle but the Smyth St corner & Taylor Rd corner need traffic regulation by use of traffic lights as vehicles and pedestrians have to wait long time in order to make a safe turn from Hwy or road or to cross Hwy as pedestrians, especially during morning or afternoon rush hours.
